column4: Alright, so, once I have network-manager installed, how can I launch it. I can't seem to find it anywhere.
its the networking icon in your panel. if its missing then either your notification area is missing, nm-applet isnt running, or you hit that bug where it disappears while nm-applet is still running
How would I launch nm-applet?
check and see if its running "ps -ef | grep nm-applet"
Grep just gets stuck when I try that.
I'm not getting any output from it.
ok then try typing "nohup nm-applet &"
nonup command not found. :(
Is nonup something that should work in 8.04? I'm getting a command not found error.
nohup not nonup
er but dont capitalize like Dr_Willis did :P
Now I feel like an idiot. :)
it happens to everybody :)
Oh dear... cannot run command "nm-applet": No such file or directory.
Am I looking at a reinstall here?
are you sure network-manager-gnome (i think thats the name) is installed?
apt-get says it is.
sudo aptitude reinstall?
and then try nohup again?
It's all still failing. I think I'm gonna try reinstalling.
It seems my install disc isn't complete. I guess nicking one off a friend wasn't a good idea.
Thanks for all your help.
